content.description: Start 2 hands in obvious hold, feet friction. Climb straight up.
content.location: In the middle of the relatively short, east facing side of the quarantine boulder.

content.description: Sit start with two hands on large upward facing corner. Climb up right face then use foodtholds on left face around the arete to top out.
content.location: On the east facing section of Quarantine, this climb is the first line on the east face, directly to the right of a large corner.

content.description: Start at the left end of a large diagonal ledge. Follow crack until it opens up into a triangular hole.  Climb straight up from hole.
content.location: Look for the mossy corner on the east face of Quarantine.  On the face to the left of that corner is a large diagonal crack and large triangular hole.

content.description: Start with 2 hands on obvious block handhold.  Climb straight up, following a line of brown lichens.
content.location: Downhill of Guten Tag Doctor, look for line of dark lichens.

content.description: Start on white hold.  Find small feet in the overhang, traverse hands left until you reach a very solid grip at the corner of the hemi-sphere.  Change feet onto the other face of the corner, then hands, and then climb up and over ledge on other side of corner.  Scramble out to top out from there.
content.location: This is the most downhill point of quarantine.  Look for a diagonal corner with a hemisphere-shaped overhang

content.description: Climb up a face with 2 interesting protruding volume features.
content.protection: Tricky to protect with crashpads, be careful.

content.description: Quarantine is the main section of short rock faces that one can see from the road.  Good combination of easy slab, and more interesting featured rock.
